It is characterized by its slender, elongated cones and relatively small, needle-like leaves. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments, typically in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Its botanical features include a conical shape, dense foliage, and a slow growth rate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
